alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 11:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stephens, central Habersham, south central Rabun, southwestern Pickens and Oconee Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1121 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of Toccoa, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Toccoa, Seneca, Walhalla, Clarkesville, Central, Cornelia, Westminster, Demorest and Mount Airy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Greater Oconee; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains
